title: Bauhaus Signage Font?
content:
Is there a font based on H.Bayer’s lettering for the Bauhaus building signage(in Dessau)?:

ex:  
 [http://www.thebreman.org/exhibitions/online/1000kids/Bauhaus.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180913/http:/www.thebreman.org/exhibitions/online/1000kids/Bauhaus.JPG "http://www.thebreman.org/exhibitions/online/1000kids/Bauhaus.JPG")

It looks like what the uppercase version of his “universal” font would look like - but the original (and P22’s digital version) only contain lowercase, from what I can tell.

this one is close, but the “S” is different:  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/dessau\_pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180913/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/dessau_pro/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/dessau\_pro/")

Thanks in advance
author: gluepet

comments.content: [Houschka](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180913/http:/www.identifont.com/show?4Y1) by Nick Cooke is similar, too, except the S. The Bayer-S has some characteristics from the later Eurostile …
Or you could mix upper- and lowercases of [Bayer Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20091124180913/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/victory/bayer-sans/bayer-sans/) …
